content.rendered:
Evolution of CCTV and its trends with Artificial Intelligence

Suresh Babu M
Infinova India Pvt. Ltd., India

Abstract:

Today’s modern age with the technology growing fast, CCTV has emerged as an important and mandatory system with its unmatching capabilities and uses. Back from 1970s with VCRs to record the footage till the cloud computing now a days there are several phases that the CCTV technology went through and emerged as a sophisticated and powerful tool.

Several improvements in the field of image sensors, Compression technologies, communication technologies, storage devices, Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning technologies etc made the CCTV system robust with unmatched features at distinction.

This talk address the Evolution of CCTV and its trends with latest technology and Artificial Intelligence.

Speaker Biography:

Suresh Babu is an Engineer in Electronics and Communications with a project on satellite communication systems. He works as Asst. General Manager for Infinova, an MNC company which manufactures CCTV cameras, VMS and Artificial Intelligence Software. He has an experience of over 20 years in the field of CCTV and Surveillance systems.

Efficient Power Supply for Flash Memory

Krishna Mahesh
Western Digital, India

Abstract:

Data storage is a very basic and critical need of the present day world where we need electronic devices like Flash memory to store and transfer data from small SD cards in mobiles to SSDs in Laptops and in cloud storage to address global demands instantly.
The data storage capacities and speeds also need to double every two years to meet the ever increasing hunger for data.
This throws up challenges of employing efficient power supplies and managing the operation of memories with the heat generated on the memories.
This talk addresses the methodologies to meet supply voltage and thermal requirements in the present day Flash memories, while still keeping the data through-put at the rate required.

Speaker Biography:

Mr. Krishna Mahesh Karanam got his B.Tech degree in Electronics & Communication Engineering from NIT,Warangal in 2004 and got his M.Tech in VLSI Design,Tools & Technology from IIT,Delhi in 2007. He worked as an Analog design Engineer in semiconductor companies like National Semiconductor,Maxim Integrated, Texas Instruments for 14 years, before joining Western Digital corporation where he is working for the past two years. He has worked on design of analog IPs like Voltage and current reference circuits,LDOs, temperature sensors,ADC/DAC,PLL , Ethernet transceivers etc.. He holds one granted US patent on Low noise operational amplifiers.

Development of Affordable Emergency Ventilator

Vinoy Vishnu Vadakkepat
Sinergia Media Labs, Kochi & Bangalore, India

Abstract:

Early December 2019, COVID-19 knocked at the doors of humanity leading to a WHO report on 5 Jan 2020. Indian lock-down started on 24 March 2020. IndVentr [www.indventr.com] consortium was formed on 29 March 2020 to develop affordable emergency ventilators. There were many COVID patients that required ventilators at the time to manage the virus and there were limited commercial ventilators. We saw ourselves capable of rising to that challenge. We started with a small group of people discussing ideas, articles, papers, open source ventilator projects, and coming up with a design and plan of action to realize that design. We had different layers of expertise with individuals and in combinations of teams. We had 3 companies working as a team to make it happen: each with its area of expertise with centralized organization scheme and regular remote meetings for understanding progress. We had no prior expertise in biomedical systems or being medical care providers. Adaptation happened to additional needed expertise through learning online. We developed ambu based and pneumatically controlled ventilators. Join the seminar to walk through the unusual journal of open innovation and inclusive leadership.

Speaker Biography:

Vishnu Vadakkepat has a B.Tech degree from Manipal Institute of Technology. An instrumentation and control engineer, Vishnu deep dived into AI and Data Analytics after graduation. He is working with Sinergia Media Labs, Kochi & Bangalore since 2019 and is part of the Indventr consortium. He is a founder of the Ionic3DP, Kochi. Entrepreneurship, AI and Philosophy are the ways of life for him. Vishnu had his schooling in Singapore at the Chatsworth International School.
